alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 07 at 8:50PM CDT until June 08 at 5:34AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Canadian River near Bridgeport affecting Caddo, Blaine, Custer and Canadian Counties.
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC011-015-017-039-081045- /O.EXT.KOUN.FL.W.0008.000000T0000Z-220608T1034Z/ /BRIO2.N.ER.220607T1343Z.220607T2000Z.220608T0434Z.NO/ 850 PM CDT Tue Jun 7 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Canadian River near Bridgeport. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Flooding affects croplands... pastures... and oil wells near the river. Flood plain fields at higher elevations away from the river may be cut off from easy access by high water in side channels. Sand dredging operations are affected. Upstream points in southern Blaine County may see flooding before the areas near Bridgeport in northern Caddo County. Downstream points in southwestern Canadian County are affected hours later. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The Canadian River has already crested and is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
